attributes.action: Cancel all NHS workers Tax and NI for 2020 - Support the NHS workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of our NHS workers have been thrust into the position of selflessly saving our nation from this virus. 2020 has brought an unprecedented requirement on NHS, having to put themselves in harm's way. This is not a usual day at work for anyone working for the NHS.

Many Mothers and Fathers will have to stay away from their families all while delivering horrific news to others. We have to make 2020 just a little easier for them the only way we can.
attributes.background: Give NHS workers at Tax Break for the entire 2020 year. No tax no National insurance. No government deductions of any kind.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign these petitions, which call for similar actions:

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073 

Reward our healthcare heroes now for risking their lives to fight Covid-19. 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318741 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
